definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: A hydrogen bomb has a built-in atomic bomb, which is needed to trigger the fusion reaction.
sentences.chinese: 氢弹内置了一颗原子弹，用于触发聚变反应。

sentences.english: Which scientist was eager to make the hydrogen bomb?
sentences.chinese: 哪一位科学家亟亟欲试制造氢弹？

sentences.english: But the H-bomb requires more technology in control and accuracy because of the greater amount of energy involved.
sentences.chinese: 由于大量的能量，氢弹需要更高控制和精度技术。

sentences.english: Poor people, have they ever heard hydrogen and neutron bombs?
sentences.chinese: 可怜的人，你们有听说过氢弹和中子弹吗？

sentences.english: The use of H-bombs would be an outrage against humanity.
sentences.chinese: 使用氢弹是违反人道的暴行。

sentences.english: The H-bomb appears on the public horizon as a probably attainable goal.
sentences.chinese: 氢弹也出现在公众的视野了，成了可行性的目标。

sentences.english: So how do you make sure the H-bombs are stillworking?
sentences.chinese: 那么，你如何确保氢弹仍然工作？

sentences.english: 1950- President Truman announced he had ordered development of the hydrogen bomb.
sentences.chinese: 1950年的今天，杜鲁门总统宣布要发展氢弹。

sentences.english: Humans have also produced the H-bomb andlanded on the Moon.
sentences.chinese: 人类还制造出了氢弹，并且还踏上了月球。

sentences.english: No doubt in a hydrogen-bomb war great cities would be obliterated.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，一场氢弹战将会毁灭大城市。

sentences.english: This H-bomb test brings us to a higher level of nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 这吃氢弹试验给我们带来一个更高层次的核力量。

sentences.english: You know, the Russians have the H-bomb.
sentences.chinese: 你知道吗，俄罗斯已经有了氢弹。

sentences.english: In fact, it is a special kind of H-bomb .
sentences.chinese: 实际上它是一种特殊的氢弹。

sentences.english: At Eniwetok Atoll , in the Pacific, the USA detonated the first hydrogen bomb.
sentences.chinese: 美国在西太平洋珊瑚礁埃尼威托克岛试爆第一颗氢弹。
